content:
Wow, an hour-long wait is dedication! But I'm glad to hear it was worth it for you. The attention to detail in the haunted house is a testament to the hard work and dedication of the designers and creators at Universal Studios Hollywood.

The Upside Down is such an iconic part of the Stranger Things universe, and it's amazing that they were able to recreate it in a way that felt so immersive and authentic. I've heard that the designers spent hours studying the show, taking notes, and even building miniature sets to get the details just right.

It's great to hear that you enjoyed the experience, and I'm sure the wait was made more bearable by the excitement and anticipation of getting to experience the haunted house. Did you have a favorite part of the haunted house, or was there a particular scare or effect that really stood out to you?

And by the way, how was the rest of your experience at Halloween Horror Nights? Did you get a chance to explore the other mazes, scare zones, and attractions?
